intro: Calycolpus gracilis, commonly known as the slender calycolpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, simple leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow and occur in clusters, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Calycolpus gracilis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
